Identification.LongTitle: Fourth Session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee on Plastic Pollution (Ottawa 2024 – INC-4) Privileges and Immunities Order

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, makes the annexed Fourth Session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee on Plastic Pollution (Ottawa 2024 – INC-4) Privileges and Immunities Order under subsection 5(1)a of the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Actb.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Order.

Definition.Text: Agreement means the Agreement between the United Nations as Represented by the United Nations Environment Programme and the Government of Canada Regarding the Fourth Session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to Develop an International Legally Binding Instrument on Plastic Pollution, including in the Marine Environment (INC-4). (Accord)
Convention means the Convention on the Privileges and Immunities of the United Nations set out in Schedule III to the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Act. (Convention)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the regional preparatory consultations to be held in Ottawa on April 21, 2024; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the meeting of the Fourth Session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to Develop an International Legally Binding Instrument on Plastic Pollution, including in the Marine Environment (INC-4), to be held in Ottawa from April 23 to 30, 2024. (réunions)

Definition.Text: relevant period means the period beginning on April 19, 2024 and ending on May 3, 2024. (période visée)

Section.Text: During the relevant period, the premises, as defined in Article 3 of the Agreement, and the archives and documents of the United Nations Environment Programme are inviolable within the meaning of section 3 of the Convention.

Subsection.Text: During the relevant period, the following persons who have been invited to attend the meetings as participants, as defined in Article 2 of the Agreement, have, to the extent required for the exercise of their functions in relation to the meetings, the privileges and immunities set out in sections 11 and 12 of Article IV of the Convention, to the extent set out in sections 14 to 16 of that Article:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: representatives of members of the United Nations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: representatives of members to specialized agencies or related organizations of the United Nations.

Subsection.Text: During the relevant period, officials of the United Nations have, to the extent required for the exercise of their functions in relation to the meetings, the privileges and immunities set out in paragraphs 18(a) and (c) to (f) of Article V of the Convention.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Officials of specialized agencies or related organizations
Subsection.Text: During the relevant period, officials of specialized agencies or related organizations of the United Nations have, to the extent required for the exercise of their functions in relation to the meetings, the privileges and immunities set out in paragraphs 18(a), (c) and (d) of Article V of the Convention.

During the relevant period, experts, other than the officials referred to in subsections (2) and (3), who are performing missions for the United Nations or its specialized agencies or related organizations have, to the extent required for the exercise of their functions in relation to the meetings, the privileges and immunities set out in Article VI of the Convention.

Section.Text: This Order comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
